flawed_nl_solution:
On 80 games, Daniel spend 80 games * $12/game = $<<80*12=960>>960.
The rest of the collection is 346 games - 80 games = <<346-80=266>>266 games.
50% of these games means 50/100 * 266 games = <<50/100*266=133.0>>133.0 games.
Daniel bought them for $7 each, so he had to spend 133.0 games * $7/game = $<<133.0*7=931.0>>931.0 on them.
The other 133.0 games were bought for $3 each, so they've cost him 133.0 games * $3/game = $<<133.0*3=399.0>>399.0.
On all games in total Daniel spent $960 + $931.0 + $399.0 = $<<960+931.0+399.0=2920.0>>2920.0.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 2290.0, not 2920.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
